SEint leonard Leonard þe confe&slong;&slong;our &punctelev; alonde eode her
Aftur o&rrot;e louerde&slong; bu&ydot;rt&ydot;me&punctelev;aboute fif hund&rrot;ed ȝer
his freond and is cunne&slong;men&punctelev;þe grette&slong;te ma&ydot;&slong;tre&slong; were
In þe k&ydot;ngus hou&slong;e of fraunce Fraunce &punctelev; gretto&rrot;e none þare nere
And &slong;eint leonard Leonard al&slong;o wa&slong; &punctelev; a gret mai&slong;ter with þe king
Of þat he him bidde wolde &punctelev; he wernde him noþing
he grauntede him alle þe p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; &punctelev; þat he fo&rrot;e bidde wolde
Aftur is bone ope al is lond&punctelev;þat men him deliueri &slong;cholde
¶Þis holie man wende aboute fa&slong;te &punctelev; p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; fo&rrot;te glade
And ȝwane he fond ani of lu&ydot;te gult &punctelev; deliuered &slong;one he made
Fo&rrot;þi Men men him cleopeden p&rrot;i&slong;ones louerd &punctelev; and ȝu&ydot;t men doth al&slong;o
Fo&rrot; non oþur halewe fo&rrot; p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; &punctelev; &slong;o fair miracle nath ido
Þe king of fraunce Fraunce him bi&slong;ouȝhte &punctelev; ȝeo&rrot;ne ope al is miȝhte
Þat he &slong;cholde with him beo &punctelev; bi da&ydot;e&slong; and bi n&ydot;ȝhte
Fo&rrot;te þare fulle ani bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; þat he him miȝhte bitake
Seint leonard Leonard nolde it graunti nouȝht &punctelev; ake outriȝht it gan fo&rrot;&slong;ake
And wende fo&rrot;th aȝein is wille &punctelev; and bad him habbe guod da&ydot;
Fo&rrot;me&slong;t he wende to Orlians&punctelev;to p&rrot;echie gode&slong; Godes la&ydot;
¶Longue he p&rrot;echede þareaboute &punctelev; þat folk fo&rrot;to lere
And sethþe he wende to Aquita&ydot;ne &punctelev; fo&rrot;to p&rrot;echie þere
Eche da&ydot;e he wolde at toune beo &punctelev; to p&rrot;echi gode&slong; Godes lawe
And eche niȝhte he wende to þe wode &punctelev; ȝwane it to eue gan d&rrot;awe
In is o&rrot;e&slong;one&slong; to beon al one &punctelev; ac &slong;o &slong;one &slong;o it wa&slong; da&ydot;
69·
Into þe contre&ydot;e he wolde aboute &punctelev; and p&rrot;echi gode&slong; Godes la&ydot;
¶Þe king hadde in þulke wode &punctelev; a tour of grete bolde
Þat he miȝhte &slong;oiourni þer &punctelev; ȝwane he euere wolde
Þe Quene was with childe grete &punctelev; þudere men gonne hire b&rrot;ingue
Ȝif heo þe bet&combtildevert;ere beterere miȝhte fo&rrot; &slong;olas &punctelev; ouercome hire childingue
Þo he wa&slong; in trauail&punctelev;heo ne miȝhte ouercome it nouȝht
So &slong;o&rrot;e heo pinede þat heo wa&slong; &punctelev; wel neiȝh to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝht
¶Þe king and alle his gret deol maden &punctelev; þat crie men heo&rrot;de hem wide
And þo &slong;eint leonard Leonard herde þarof &punctelev; he gan heo&rrot;kni and abide
Þo he iheo&rrot;de þat it wa&slong; of men &punctelev; þudere he gan wende
Ȝif god God wolde ani amendement &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is bone hire &slong;ende
To þe king he wende anon &punctelev; and axede ȝwat him were
beo glad he &slong;eide fo&rrot; of þi Quene quene &punctelev; ne haue þou none fere
A
Merci merci &slong;ire quath þe king &punctelev; al mi lond ichullde ȝ&ydot;ue
ho&slong;o miȝhte
it þarto b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; þat þe Quene mo&slong;te liue
¶Fo&rrot; of þe childe ne rouȝhte i nouȝht &punctelev; miȝhte ich habbe hire lif
Sire &slong;eide þis holie Man man &punctelev; lat me i&slong;eo þi wif
Ȝif ich hire ma&ydot; to liue b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; and þat child al&slong;o
Þo&rrot;uȝ mine louerdes &slong;wete grace &punctelev; nere it wel ido
Þis holie Man man wa&slong; to þe Quene ib&rrot;ouȝht &punctelev; þat lai ȝare to deþe
So clene heo wa&slong; with pine ouercome &punctelev; þat vnneþe heo miȝhte b&rrot;eþe
¶Seint leonard Leonard &slong;at adoun akne &punctelev; and is p&rrot;eiere made
Þat o&rrot;e louerd hire deliueri &slong;scholde &punctelev; hire freond fo&rrot;to glade
And þat heo mo&slong;te to liue come &punctelev; and al&slong;o þat child þere
Þat Men men miȝhten &slong;eo þat þe grace &punctelev; of o&rrot;e louerd muche were
¶Þe Quen anon þo&rrot;uȝh is bone &punctelev; deliuered wa&slong; of childe
In guod lif and hire child al&slong;o &punctelev; þare wa&slong; o&rrot;e louerd wel milde
¶Þo þe king i&slong;a&ydot; þe Quene &slong;auf &punctelev; and þat child al&slong;o
Fo&rrot; io&ydot;e he nu&slong;te ȝwat he miȝhte &punctelev; with þat holie man do
he bad he &slong;cholde of al is guod &punctelev; nime ȝwat he wolde
Seint leonard Leonard &slong;eide ne kepe i nouȝht &punctelev; of þi &slong;eluer ne of þi guolde
Bote a place þat ich mowe &punctelev; in gode&slong; Godes &slong;erui&slong;e inne liue
Certe&slong; &slong;eide þe king and ichulle &punctelev; al þis wode þe ȝiue
Ne kepe ich quath &slong;eint leonard Leonard &punctelev; nouȝht mo&rrot;e of þe ibide
Bote þat ich ma&ydot; in one niȝhte &punctelev; with min A&slong;&slong;e asse ouerride
¶Ich graunti it þe &slong;eide þe king &punctelev; ne wende þou no &slong;o wide
Þei heo were quicko&rrot;e þane ani be&slong;t &punctelev; þat is bi þis wode&slong;ide
Þis guode man aboute þis wode wende &punctelev; opo opon is A&slong;&slong;e asse wel &slong;tille
And birod al&slong;o muche place&punctelev;a&slong;e it wa&slong; is wille
Þe king þo it imarked wa&slong; &punctelev; liet wal makie aboute
And Aftur aftur is wille he liet arere &punctelev; noble hous and p&rrot;oute
¶Þare seint leonard Leonard
Monk monk bicam &punctelev; a&slong;e it an Abbe&ydot;e abbeye were
And mani oþere he nam in to him &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerde&slong; lawe to arere
he bigan þare a religion &punctelev; of o&rrot;d&rrot;e swiþe &slong;trongue
Clerkus þat wolden guode men beo &punctelev; to him he gan hem fongue
·69· 189
Nier þane a gret Mile mile wei &punctelev; no watur nadden hu&ydot; þere
Seint leonard Leonard hopede amendi þat &punctelev; ȝif gode&slong; Godes wille it were
he bigan openi þe eo&rrot;þe a lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and is o&rrot;e&slong;sones he made
A &slong;wiþe fair welle þare &slong;p&rrot;ong up &punctelev; þat þareinne men miȝhte wade
Þo miȝhten hu&ydot; habbe watur inovȝ &punctelev; þe ȝwile þat hous ila&slong;te
Þo&rrot;uȝȝ gode&slong; Godes grace and &slong;eint leonardes Leonardes bone &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e ⁁miȝhte þareto ca&slong;ten
¶p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; louerd &slong;eint
leonard Leonard &punctelev; ful wide icleopud wa&slong;
Ore louerd him &slong;chewede fa&ydot;r miracle &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;ome þingue it was
Fo&rrot; ȝwane p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; criden to him &punctelev; manie with d&rrot;eo&rrot;ie chere
heo&rrot;e biende&slong; bo&rrot;&slong;ten alle ato &punctelev; and hu&ydot; deliurede were
Manie comen to þonki him &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e feotere&slong; with heom bere
And manie to &slong;erui o&rrot;e louerd cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; bilefden with him þere
¶Seue Men men with alle heo&rrot;e freond &punctelev; þat weren of is kunne
Þo hu&ydot; heo&rrot;den of is guodne&slong;&slong;e telle &punctelev; hu&ydot; &slong;olden lond and wunne
And wenden and woneden þare with him &punctelev; holi lif to lede
Þis holie Man man of gode&slong; Godes lawe &punctelev; gan heom wi&slong;&slong;i and rede
So fair Miracle miracle a&slong;e of him was &punctelev; no man nouȝwere nu&slong;te
Mani sik Man man þare hadde bote &punctelev; þat to him wel tru&slong;te
¶Atþe la&slong;te þe þo he &slong;cholde heonne fare &punctelev; longue atfo&rrot;e he it wu&slong;te
his b&rrot;eþ&rrot;en he cleopede alle to him &punctelev; and wel mildeliche hem cu&slong;te
And wende to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene &punctelev; þo god God aftur him &slong;ende
Gret deol alle is b&rrot;eþ&rrot;en maden &punctelev; þo he þanne&slong; wende
Ȝif o&rrot;e louerd fair Miracle miracle dude &punctelev; on eo&rrot;þe bi is liue
Aftur þat he wa&slong; heonne iwend &punctelev; he dude &slong;wuche fiue
¶Fo&rrot; miracle þat þare wa&slong; &punctelev; muche folk þudere gan falle
Þat þe place ne miȝhte nouȝht &punctelev; bi manie holden alle
¶Þat folk cride on o&rrot;e louerd ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; þre daiȝe&slong; and þ&rrot;e niȝht
Þat he &sllong;cholde ȝif is wille were &punctelev; þarof don in&sllong;iȝht
hu&ydot; i&sllong;eiȝen þo þe contreie alaboute &punctelev; iheoled al mid &sllong;nowe
And a place amidde fair and grene &punctelev; Men men miȝhten þaron mowe
Þo i&sllong;eien hu&ydot; þat o&rrot;e louerd wolde &punctelev; þat þis guode man leiȝe þere
hu&ydot; lieten him bere þudere anon &punctelev; and a wel fair churche arere
Þat al þe folk þat þudere cam &punctelev; ne miȝhte fulle þe place
Þat o&rrot;e louerd him hadde icho&sllong;e &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is &sllong;wete grace
¶Þe scherreue of leouns Leouns &punctelev; fetere&slong; made &slong;trongu &slong;trongue
And in þe hexte tour of þe ca&slong;tel &punctelev; þare he liet heom heom
hongue
So heiȝe þat ech man heom miȝhte i&slong;eo &punctelev; þat bi þe we&ydot;ȝe &slong;cholde wiende
And euerech man þat þaron were &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e him fo&rrot;to &slong;chende
Þat Men men þat &slong;chuu&ydot;ch to&rrot;ment i&slong;eiȝen &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e &slong;cholden d&rrot;ede
La&slong;te hu&ydot; weren þaron ib&rrot;ouȝht &punctelev; to don ani mi&slong;dede
So þat he nam ane trewe Man man &punctelev; fo&rrot; a lu&ydot;te le&slong;ingue
And dude him binde &slong;wiþe fa&slong;te &punctelev; and in þulke feotere&slong;s b&rrot;ingue
With pine and &slong;o&rrot;ewe þis &slong;eli man wa&slong; &punctelev; alme&slong;t ib&rrot;ouȝt to deþe
To &slong;eint leonard Leonard he cride ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; a&slong;e he miȝhte &slong;peke onneþe
¶Seint leonard Leonard cam a niȝht to him &punctelev; in &slong;wiþe ȝwite wede
Fo&rrot; þou ha&slong;t to me ȝeo&rrot;ne ibede &punctelev; here ich am he &slong;eide
Þine &slong;trongue feteres b&rrot;ing with þe &punctelev; ne haue þou none d&rrot;ede
And aris up sone a and cum fo&rrot;th with me &punctelev; fo&rrot; henne ichulle þe ledeHorstmann believes lines 115 and 116 have been transposed. This is presumably on external evidence.
¶Op aros þis &slong;elie man &punctelev; with wel glade chere
his fetere&slong; bo&rrot;&slong;ten &slong;one atwo &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; bicomen ful &slong;ere
And seint leonard Leonard ladde him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; a&slong;e he is felawe were
To þe churche þat he inne la&ydot; &punctelev; and hanguede is feteres þere
Euere a&slong;e hu&ydot; bi þe we&ydot;e eoden &punctelev; þis holie man with him tolde
A&slong;e þe&ydot; he hadde is felawe ibeo &punctelev; bi þe hond he gan him holde
Þe schirreue cam an oþur da&ydot; &punctelev; and is fetere&slong; &slong;ouȝhte
he &slong;aiȝh þat he tolde lu&ydot;te of him &punctelev; þat heom þudere b&rrot;ouȝhte
¶A luþur Man man in gret power &punctelev; in an oþur &slong;tude wa&slong; al&slong;o
Ane gultele&slong;e Man man he hadde inome &punctelev; and in &slong;trong p&rrot;i&slong;one ido
he heo&rrot;de telle of seint leonard Leonard &punctelev; þat þe p&rrot;i&slong;one&slong; help wa&slong;
And þouȝhte fram him is p&rrot;i&slong;un wite &punctelev; with &slong;om quo&ydot;nte cas
he liet maken of lim and &slong;ton &punctelev; a wonderliche deop put
And wit &slong;trongue do&rrot;e&slong; of Ire ire and &slong;tiel &punctelev; &slong;w&ydot;þe fa&slong;te he wa&slong; idut
Onouewarde þe fallinde do&rrot;e &punctelev; þo þe guode Man man wa&slong; þarinne
A &slong;trong ȝwuchche of Ire ire he liet maken &punctelev; with wel quo&ydot;nte ginne
Þareinne he dude &slong;talewo&rrot;þe Men men &punctelev; þane p&rrot;i&slong;on fo&rrot;to wite
Þat seint leonard Leonard ne &slong;cholde neiȝh him come &punctelev; bote he were underȝite
Þe &slong;elie Man man þat bineoþe was &punctelev; in &slong;o &slong;trong warde ib&rrot;ouȝt
Criede ȝeo&rrot;ne on &slong;eint leonard Leonard &punctelev; þat he ne furȝete him nouȝht
¶A n&ydot;ȝht cam þis holie man &punctelev; And and þe ȝwuchche he fond þere
Sone he ȝweluede hire op þe doun &punctelev; and heom þat þareinne were
And &slong;ethþe he b&rrot;ac þe Irene irene do&rrot;e &punctelev; and a&slong;e a mai&slong;ter he wende adoun
with &slong;w&ydot;þe gret l&ydot;ȝht of heouene &punctelev; and &slong;pac with þat p&rrot;i&slong;oun
Slepe&slong;tþou he &slong;eide ich am icome &punctelev; þat þou ha&slong;t icleopud so
Godes de&slong;ciple leonard Leonard &punctelev;ȝwat woltþou habbe ido
louerd &slong;eide þis selie man &punctelev; al&slong;o wis ich bidde þe
A&slong;e ich am gultles here ido &punctelev; þat þou helpe me
Anonriȝht þis holie Man man &punctelev; þe G&ydot;ue&slong; he tob&rrot;ac
And bitweone is Armes armes he bar him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; no man aȝein him ne &slong;pac
And &slong;o hom to is owene hous&punctelev;bitwene is Armes armes him bar
he bad him beon a guod man&punctelev;and &slong;ette him adoun þar
¶Þis luþere men wit alle ho&rrot;e ginne&slong; &punctelev; fiebleliche habbuth aguonne
hu&ydot; miȝhten hangen up heo&rrot;e Ax ax &punctelev; and leuen weo&rrot;k &punctelev; fo&rrot; lu&ydot;te hu&ydot; þare wonne
¶A luþer man in Alema&ydot;gne &punctelev; an onkouth pilegrim nam
And b&rrot;ouȝhte him into &slong;trong p&rrot;i&slong;oun &punctelev; and ȝaf him &slong;wiþe hard dom
Þat bote his freond him wolden out bugge &punctelev; he &slong;cholde bileue þere
Þis &slong;elie Man man nadde no freond &punctelev; and Maude maude wel reulich chere
he bad fo&rrot; &slong;eint leonarde&slong; Leonardes loue &punctelev; þat he merci of him hadde

An oþur niȝht eft&slong;one he cam &punctelev; and þe þ&rrot;idde niȝht al&slong;o
And hiet him deliuri his &slong;eriaunt &punctelev; ake neuere he nolde it do
¶Seint leonard Leonard ladde þis &slong;elie man &punctelev; fram þe p&rrot;i&slong;one among heom alle
Þe heiȝe tour of þat Ca&slong;tel castel C anon aftur him &punctelev; adoun gan falle
And aslov al þat folk þat þare was &punctelev; bote þene louerd one
Ake boþe is leggue&slong; b&rrot;eken atwo &punctelev; with fallingue fallingue
of ane &slong;tone
Þat neuereft ne miȝhte he beon hol &punctelev; noþur of flechs ne of bone
Croked he wa&slong; al is lif &punctelev; he nu&slong;te to ȝwam mene is mone
¶Al&slong;o in Bruta&ydot;ne wa&slong; a kn&ydot;ȝht &punctelev; þat in &slong;trong p&rrot;i&slong;one wa&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝht
To seint leonard Leonard he cride fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat he ofte hadde i&slong;ouȝht
Streite wardeines ouer him þare weren &punctelev; boþe n&ydot;ȝht and da&ydot;
Þare he with &slong;trongue feteres &punctelev; in p&rrot;i&slong;one ibounde la&ydot;
Seint leonard Leonard among alle þe wardeins &punctelev; into þe p&rrot;i&slong;one cam

his biende&slong; he b&rrot;ac fo&rrot;me&slong;t atwo &punctelev; and ladde him bi þe hond
Among alle is wardeins &punctelev; hom into is owene lond
¶his feoteres he tok him in is h⁁ond &punctelev; þat he fo&rrot;th with him bar
To &slong;eint Seint
leonardes Leonardes Chapele&punctelev;and among oþure hieng heom þar
Þo ne do&rrot;&slong;te non of þe wardeine&slong; &punctelev; a wo&rrot;d speke with mouþe
Swuch a man ma&ydot; wel ma&ydot;&slong;ter hote &punctelev; þat so heom aga&slong;te couþe
Þe Miracles miracles þat he fo&rrot; p&rrot;i&slong;ones dude &punctelev; ne ma&ydot; no man telle
Nov god God fo&rrot; þe bone of Seint leonard Leonard &punctelev; u&slong; &slong;childe fram þe pine of helle
